website_summaries.verdict: Microsoft's ambitious love letter to creative professionals is the touchscreen iMac of your dreams -- albeit crazy expensive and running Windows.
pros: The Surface Studio has a fantastic 28-inch screen with excellent color, mounted on smooth hinges that fold down to an artist-friendly angle
The excellent Surface Pen stylus returns and the new Surface Dial shows promise
Every model has good-to-great dedicated graphics hardware
cons: Surface Studio is extremely expensive, and doesn't include the flashy Dial accessory by default
It skips newer graphics chips that support VR hardware
Support for the Dial is limited right now, and even compatible programs don't always use it in a practical way
A couple of front-mounted USB ports or a Thunderbolt connection would've been nice

customer_reviews.title: Surface Studio (1st Gen)
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the unit is built well, the internals are very sub-par. It's like they took parts from a cheap laptop and paired it with a high end touch screen monitor. The unit is way over priced, and when the Surface studio 2 arrived a few months later, Microsoft would not even offer a trade in value on my unit. I would not recommend buying this as there are cheaper units (Dell Canvas 27) that can do the same thing, but attached to your own computer.

customer_reviews.text: Having had the surface pro 4, surface laptop I went ahead with the i7 2tb 32gb surface studio. The built in HDD is a cheap 5400 rpm 2tb with a separate SSD. The os is constantly at a 75-100% for disk usages and the update took forever as in hours and hours due to the slow hdd. I can't believe they put a 5400 rpm drive in a 4k+ machine !!! File transfers seem to use the SSD buy my goodness the 2tb drive is so slow...

customer_reviews.title: Slow and unreliable
customer_reviews.text: There is no doubt this machine is very pleasing to the eye, but when push comes to shove it falls flat on its face. The machine is very slow. Visual Studio takes much longer to load on the Studio than it does on, for example, my Alienware Aurora desktop. Another big problem is the constant hardware issues: "Couldn't turn on camera, Please sign in with your PIN." Sometimes this can be resolved by updating the camera drivers, but the fact that it goes from working one day to not working the next makes for a very frustrating, and time wasting experience.

customer_reviews.title: Most Productive System ever
customer_reviews.text: Microsoft marketing missed the boat by marketing this to artists. It is really a great productivity tool for attorneys and editors. I can mark up documents in half the time it normally takes me using printed paper. Before the Studio, I never wanted to read or revised documents on a computer, not I prefer it. Aside from the giant productivity boost, I have saved myself, and the environment, from having to print thousands of pages of documents. If you review and revise documents, this system is an absolute must-have.
